content: Research the anatomical structure and physiological functions of the heart, and succinctly summarize the information obtained in a single sentence.

The heart is a muscular organ with four chambers—two atria and two ventricles—responsible for pumping oxygenated blood throughout the body and deoxygenated blood to the lungs for oxygenation, regulated by electrical impulses and supported by a network of valves, vessels, and tissues.
